title: Thunderbird 102.7.1 : office365 acc stopped working after upgrade
content:
Today, I updated the system (including thunderbird) on my KDE Neon machine (Ubuntu Linux with KDE).

Before the update, I normally received e-mails from my (company) O365 SMTP/Oauth2 account.

After the update, it simingly forgot the password as it opened a company webpage asking for credentials (Oauth2 thing). The password is accepted, the popup closes - but then the TB says "authentication failure when connecting to server outlook.office365.com") and it opens popup again.

It happened on both of my machines right after updating to 102.7.1.

Details:

M$ O365 acc: IMAP using SSL/TLS and OAuth2 TB version: 102.7.1+build1.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1~mt1

Any ideas on how to fix that?

title: Thunderbird upgrade to 102.7.1 breaks microsoft login
content: Good day, I am using Thunderbird for mail on Kubuntu linux and have two separate IMAP accounts configured. One of the mail accounts is a Microsoft account. This has worked perfectly for several years. After upgrading to 102.7.1 (64-bit) yesterday, I can no longer access new mail on the Microsoft account. My other IMAP account continues to work as usual, so the problem appears to be specific to the Microsoft login. When attempting to retrieve emails I receive the following error - "Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com. " I continue to receive emails from this account on my phone and if I use the webmail interface, so there appears to be an issue with Thunderbird / Outlook server configuration. Please let me know if there is any information I can provide that will help solve the problem.
creator: paul506

title: cannot access or add outlook account in thunderbird; all other accounts work
content: I had been using my outlook account in Thunderbird for years, but have not for the past 2 years or so. I have multiple email accounts set up in Thunderbird now. All but one -- the outlook.com account -- work. For some reason, despite having the correct username and password, Thunderbird continues to FAIL. I've researched online and tried other server settings, and have confirmed my outlook accounts server settings on outlook.com, and have ensured the settings are identical to what is entered in Thunderbird, but nothing works in Thunderbird. Windows MAIL also works fine. Thunderbird Error is attached. As FYI, I also tried disabling 2 factor authentication in Microsoft, in case that is the issue, but that didn't work either. I also tried deleting and re-adding my outlook account in Thunderbird in case there was some new configuration on Outlook side that was not being captured in Thunderbird. That didn't work either. So now I'm at a loss! I'd appreciate ANY assistance anyone familiar with this issue can give me! In case needed, I do not subscribe to Office365. I'm only using Outlook.com, etc. Please help! Thanks in advance!
creator: d.o.holmes

title: Import from Outlook 2010 does  not properly bring in message addresses in Sent folders
content:
I am trying to migrate to Thunderbird from Outlook 2010.

I am using the TB import functions for Outlook on a machine with outlook installed.

All of my mail messages come into TB correctly except those in my "Sent" folders (email I have sent to others). In >90% of these, the email address I sent From and the addresses I sent To are all replaced with text names. This makes it impossible to "reply all" for example as the entities that should be addresses are only names.

A suggestion was previously made to turn off the Thunderbird option to Display address Book names instead of email addresses for contacts in your address book, but this option was already off.

I am about to try deleting my address book in Outlook and then import again and see if this "breaks any links" that might be existing in Outlook.

Does anyone have any ideas on how to make these email import correctly?

Has anyone else noticed this behavior in the Sent mails folders when importing from Outlook?

title: TB 102.7.0 on Linux disappears all messages in sent folder
content:
Hello, I have seen similar reports on that issue here and elsewhere. What surprises me is that if I right click on the sent folder and select properties, it still gives me the right number of messages in that folder.

In fact, If I go to ~/.thunderbird/my_profile.default/Mail/pop.gmail-2.com/Sent.sbd/2023 and open that file with whatever text editor, file 2023 contains all messages sent. I have tried repairing that file, then restarting TB to no avail. Is there a workaround ?

-Tx

title: Login to server outlook.office365.com with username xxxxxxxxxxxxx failed
content:
Recently (~January 25, 2023) in Thunderbird (102.7.0) my outlook.com email (SMTP) stopped working with the error message, "Login to server outlook.office365.com with username xxxxxxxxxx failed."

  • I see some have suggested changing Authentication method to "OAuth" from "Normal Password" but this has not helped. (Not sure if OAuth is different than OAuth2, but only OAuth2 is an option in Thunderbird)
  • I have tried setting the Authentication to OAuth2 in the outlook.com account => account settings => Edit SMTP server
  • I have tried setting the Authentication to OAuth2 in the outlook.com account => Server Settings
  • In the outlook.com account => Server Settings - Connection security is set to SSL/TLS; Port is 993
  • In the outlook.com account => account settings => Edit SMTP server Connection security is set to SSL/TLS; Port is 465

creator: rbb4

title: Thunderbird address book gone/empty/corrupted
content:
How I got where I am: 1) My hard drive started going out. I was unable to get a backup with Windows or 3rd party backup programs. I started copying what I could, just straight copy/paste, nothing fancy. Yes, there's the possibility of corrupted files at any point during this process, though chkdsk, etc. say otherwise. Supposedly, all the bad sectors have been detected and walled off. 2) Did a clean installation of Windows 10 on the new drive and started copying in the stuff I had gotten from the dying drive. This specifically included my Thunderbird profile. Thunderbird itself is a clean, current install (102.6.1...or at least that's what downloaded the other day--it's now asking if I want to get 102.7). 3) When I run Thunderbird, there are no addresses in my personal address book. It seems to have "collected" a couple from emails that I have looked at, but that's all. There's no abook.mab or history.mab to be found. There are abook.mab.bak and history.mab.bak files.

So, I need my addresses and...

What I've tried: 1) As I said above, I copied over the entire profile from the dying drive. Presumably that should have included both abook.mab and history.mab files. I am assuming that they were corrupted and were not available to copy. Looking at the bad drive, they do not show up; only the *.bak files. 2) I tried renaming abook/history.mab.bak as *.mab. Didn't work. 3) I tried copying the .mab files from a backup I took a while back into my current profile. Didn't work. 4) I tried renaming abook/history.sqlite and restarting Thunderbird, per https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1306681. Didn't work. I lost even the few addresses that I had collected (yes, they came back when I deleted *.sqlite and re-renamed *.sqlite back to their original file names). Note that Thunderbird did not create new *.bak files the way the answer in 1306681 said would happen. The old *.bak files are still there (assuming that you guys aren't playing tricks with the date stamp on the old files...can't fathom any reason why you would). 5) I tried a few other things from the Support here, but don't have specific notes. Suffice it to say that none worked.

I've spent hours on this and have gotten nowhere. I note that the answers that I'm seeing here all have dates from at least a couple of years ago (or more). Has Thunderbird changed sufficiently that those older responses are no longer valid? Am I so short on sleep that I'm making newb mistakes? Have aliens infested my computer? Inquiring minds want to know.

Thanks...
creator: greyrollins
